name: SearchInclude
documentation:
Marker annotation that indicates that a property is to be included when indexing a document for search. When a property is included, the document can be matched using this property. Note that inclusion is the default for properties, so this annotation is only useful to override the effects of {@link SearchExclude}(true) on a parent or ancestor.

When this annotation is present on a type, all properties of the class will be included when indexing, unless they are individually annotated with {@link SearchExclude}(true).

Note that this annotation is an alias for {@link SearchExclude}(false) and has the same effect.
